name: vintage chevron blanket, knit version
notes:
materials
to make your own small throw (large throw), you’ll need…

- 1 (2) of purl soho’s [vintage chevron blanket bundles][1]. each bundle contains 10 balls of [till][2], 100% andean highland wool yarn. each ball of this worsted- to chunky-weight yarn is 136 yards/ 100 grams; approximately 1,350 (2,300) total yards required.

you’ll also need…
- us 10 (6 mm), 32- or 47-inch [circular knitting needles][3]
- a [removable stitch marker][4] or piece of scrap yarn

gauge
16 stitches and 32 rows (16 ridges) = 4 inches in regular garter stitch

one 28-stitch pattern repeat = 5½ inches wide

22 rows (11 ridges) in chevron pattern = approximately 4¼ inches tall, measured from “mountain to mountain” or “valley to valley”

sizes
small throw (large throw)

finished dimensions: 33 inches wide x 42½ inches tall (49½ inches wide x 57½ inches tall)

samples: we knit the small throw size for all of our samples.

prefer to crochet this blanket instead? we've also designed a [crochet version][5]!

designed by purl soho designer, [gaby bush][6].


  [1]: https://www.purlsoho.com/vintage-chevron-blanket-bundle.html
  [2]: https://www.purlsoho.com/till.html
  [3]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/collection_filter--circular_needles.html
  [4]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/collection_filter--stitch_markers.html
  [5]: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/vintage-chevron-blanket-crochet-version
  [6]: https://www.purlsoho.com/create/tag/gaby-bush-for-purl-soho/
